body_html:
Those xcode project files are in the contrib folder, so they are community supported. We don't have any automated regression tests that guarantee they stay correct. We also aren't able to test them manually when we make changes to our Bazel build.

It is likely that 65038b0 is what broke the xcode project definitions. Perhaps you could help us fix these files. I'm marking this issue as contributions welcome.

Those xcode project files are in the contrib folder, so they are community supported. We don't have any automated regression tests that guarantee they stay correct. We also aren't able to test them manually when we make changes to our Bazel build.
It is likely that 65038b0 is what broke the xcode project definitions. Perhaps you could help us fix these files. I'm marking this issue as contributions welcome.
body:
Those xcode project files are in the contrib folder, so they are community supported. We don't have any automated regression tests that guarantee they stay correct. We also aren't able to test them manually when we make changes to our Bazel build.

It is likely that https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/65038b084059cf934df50fa86dba5b0e765f9d65 is what broke the xcode project definitions. Perhaps you could help us fix these files. I'm marking this issue as contributions welcome.
